required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Alloplastic Total Temporomandibular Joint (TMJ) Replacement Registry
clinical_study.official_title: International, Multicenter, Prospective Registry to Collect Data of Patients Treated With Alloplastic Total Temporomandibular Joint (TMJ) Replacements

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective data will be collected in approximately 200 patients treated with an TMJ replacement. Patients will be followed up according to the standard (routine) for up to 5 years after the treatment. Data collection will include underlying disease, treatment details, functional and patient reported outcomes (PRO)s and anticipated or procedure-related adverse events (i.e. complications).
This registry is designed to be able to assess the number of patients who refuse alloplastic total TMJ replacement. Therefore, the participating sites are asked to register all cases of refused TMJ replacements too.

detailed_description.textblock:
More in detail this registry has the following objectives:
- To describe clinical indications for TMJ replacement, and treatment patterns (including differences among regions if feasible)
- To describe the clinical evolution and outcomes of patients treated with a TMJ replacement
- To explore the relationship(s) between treatment, outcome(s) and quality of life (QoL).
- To identify predictive factors for favorable outcomes (pain reduction, range of motion (ROM), occlusal status, QoL) in patients treated with TMJ replacement.
- To describe the reasons of patients who refused TMJ replacements

primary_outcome.measure: The registry has no primary but several objectives.
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
primary_outcome.description: due to the study design, no primary objective has been defined and therefore no primary outcome measure either

secondary_outcome.measure: Demographics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative
secondary_outcome.description: Year of birth Gender Smoking

secondary_outcome.measure: Comorbidities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative
secondary_outcome.description: Concomitant diseases will be assessed using the Charlson Comorbidity Index (CCI). This score assesses the comorbidity level by considering both the number and severity of pre-defined comorbid conditions. It provides a weighted score of a patient's comorbidities which can be used to predict mortality rates

secondary_outcome.measure: Refusal of alloplastic total TMJ replacement surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative
secondary_outcome.description: For patients who require alloplastic total TMJ replacement but refuse surgery, the reason(s) for refusal will be collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical and functional outcomes - Mandibular movements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Interincisial opening/maximal opening Lateral movements Protrusive movement

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical and functional outcomes - Occlusal status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Occlusion will be assessed according to Angle's classification:

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical and functional outcomes - Dentition
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Dental status will be recorded as: Edentulous Complete dentition Partial dentition In case of partial dentition, missing teeth will be recorded individually using the Fédération Dentaire Internationale (FDI) tooth numbering formula .

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical and functional outcomes - Helkimo Clinical dysfunction index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The dysfunction of the mandible will be evaluated by means of the Helkimo index. The Helkimo index is based on the assessment of five different symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes - Pain numeric rating scale (NRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The Pain NRS is an 11-point scale where the end points are the extremes of no pain (0 points), to worst imaginable pain (10 points). It measures subjective intensity of pain and the patient rates his/her overall or average daily pain. Will be assessed independently for each site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes - Jaw function NRS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The jaw function NRS is an 11-point scale where the end points are the extremes of normal jaw movement (0 points), to no jaw movement (10 points). It measures subjective jaw function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes - Diet limitation NRS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The diet limitation NRS is an 11-point scale where the end points are the extremes of no restrictions (0 points), to liquids only (10 points). It measures subjective diet limitations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes - EuroQoL five dimension (EQ-5D-5L)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L descriptive system comprises the following five dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems and extreme problems. The patient is asked to indicate his/her health state by ticking the box next to the most appropriate statement in each of the five dimensions. This decision results into a 1-digit number that expresses the level selected for that dimension. The digits for the five dimensions can be combined into a 5-digit number that describes the patient's health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcomes - Oral Health Impact Profile (OHIP) - 14
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months
secondary_outcome.description: The OHIP is concerned with impairment and three functional status dimensions (social, psychological and physical) which represent four of the seven quality of life dimensions proposed by Patrick and Bergner. Hence, it excludes perceptions of satisfaction with oral health, changes in oral health, prognosis or self-reported diagnoses. Furthermore, the OHIP aims to capture impacts that are related to oral conditions in general, rather than impacts that may be attributed to specific oral disorders or syndromes. All impacts in the OHIP are conceptualized as adverse outcomes, and therefore the instrument does not measure any positive aspects of oral health. The OHIP consists of 14 items evaluated using a 5-point Likert from "Never" to "Very often " in which higher scores indicated worse outcomes. It has validated translations to Swedish, Spanish, German, Hindi and further more.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anticipated treatment or condition-related adverse events (i.e. complications)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the pre-operative assessment until 60 months after surgery (10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months)
secondary_outcome.description: In this registry, only anticipated condition, treatment-, or implant-related adverse events (i.e. complications) will be documented in the electronic case report form (eCRF) from the time of consent onwards. In the context of the registry, these events are considered as events of scientific interest, i.e. events that can clearly be connected to the treatment(s) or the medical condition under investigation. These events do not require immediate reporting unless they occur at a higher frequency and/or severity to that cited in the literature

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 days / 3 months / 6 months / 12 months / 24 months / 60 months
secondary_outcome.description: Follow up (FU) visits will be scheduled and performed according to the local standard of care and at each scheduled visit the patient's survival will be documented. In case a patient misses a scheduled visit, it will be assessed if the patient is still alive, which can be done via phone call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological parameters - Displacement of ramus component
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative / 10 days / 12 months / 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: All images (preferably computed tomography (CT) / cone beam (CB) CT scan) taken as part of the standard (routine) will be collected and 'displacement of ramus component' evaluated by local investigator:

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological parameters - Fracture of ramus component
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative / 10 days / 12 months / 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: All images (preferably computed tomography (CT) / cone beam (CB) CT scan) taken as part of the standard (routine) will be collected and evaluated by local investigator if a 'fracture of the ramus component' occurred

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological parameters - Screw loosening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative / 10 days / 12 months / 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: All images (preferably computed tomography (CT) / cone beam (CB) CT scan) taken as part of the standard (routine) will be collected and evaluated by local investigator if 'screw loosening' occurred

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological parameters - Resorption/ osteolysis of surrounding bone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative / 10 days / 12 months / 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: All images (preferably computed tomography (CT) / cone beam (CB) CT scan) taken as part of the standard (routine) will be collected and 'resorption/ osteolysis of surrounding bone' evaluated by local investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological parameters - Status of bone grafts if used (displaced/ resorbed/ healed)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative / 10 days / 12 months / 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: All images (preferably computed tomography (CT) / cone beam (CB) CT scan) taken as part of the standard (routine) will be collected and 'status of bone grafts if used (displaced/ resorbed/ healed)' evaluated by local investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological parameters - Presence of ectopic bone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operative / 10 days / 12 months / 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: All images (preferably computed tomography (CT) / cone beam (CB) CT scan) taken as part of the standard (routine) will be collected and 'presence of ectopic bone' evaluated by local investigator

arm_group.description: All treatments will remain the standard (routine) care procedures based on individual clinician's judgment and the patient characteristics. The registry does not dictate any specific treatment.

study_pop.textblock: Patients requiring alloplastic total TMJ replacement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 years and or older
- Patients requiring alloplastic total TMJ replacement
- Informed consent obtained, i.e.:
- Ability to understand the content of the patient information/informed consent form (ICF)
- Willingness and ability to participate in the registry according to the Registry Plan (RP)
- Signed and dated ethics committee (EC) / Institutional review board (IRB) approved written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recent history of substance abuse (i.e. recreational drugs, alcohol) that would preclude reliable assessment
- Pregnancy or women planning to conceive within the study period
- Participation in any other medical device or medicinal product study within the previous month that could influence the results of the present study
